Name: Merry Widow(er)
Ingredients: 1 dash Peychaud's or other Creole-style bitters
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of lemon zest twist.
EXPRESS lemon zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: A Fifty-Fifty Martini with delicate herbal and aniseed notes.
History: The Merry Widow first appears in Hugo R. Ensslin's 1917 Recipes for Mixed Drinks (2nd Edition) (It may have also appeared in his 1916 first edition.) The cocktail also appears in Harry Craddock 's 1930 The Savoy Cocktail Book and Albert Stevens Crockett's 1935 The Old Waldorf-Astoria Bar Book . This cocktail takes its name from The Merry Widow Broadway production which opened on 21st October 1907 at the New Amsterdam Theatre. The operetta was premiered in Vienna in 1905, and played all around the world, leading to a ballet version and at least five film versions.
